text:
I have mysterious problem with apache httpd 2.2.0 on Linux 2.6 using glibc 2.3. 
I'm using (and debugging the thing with) worker at this moment (but the problem 
happened also with prefork).

Server runs nicely for some time and then it shutdowns itself:
[Tue Feb 07 13:47:05 2006] [notice] child pid 19793 exit signal Segmentation 
fault (11)
[... several file not found errors ...]
Tue Feb 07 13:47:26 2006] [warn] child process 19058 still did not exit, 
sending a SIGTERM
[Tue Feb 07 13:47:26 2006] [warn] child process 16012 still did not exit, 
sending a SIGTERM

sending a SIGTERM

sending a SIGTERM

sending a SIGKILL

sending a SIGKILL

sending a SIGKILL

sending a SIGKILL

sending a SIGKILL
[Tue Feb 07 13:47:28 2006] [error] child process 17339 still did not exit, 
sending a SIGKILL
[Tue Feb 07 13:47:28 2006] [error] child process 14126 still did not exit, 
sending a SIGKILL
[Tue Feb 07 13:47:29 2006] [notice] caught SIGTERM, shutting down

It seems that is somehow misinterprets child segfault as sigterm signal? Such 
thing wasn't happening with apache 2.0. Note that when using grsecurity (which 
logs all signal deliveries) I see no SIGTERM being send to apache process!

This means that something else than SIGTERM is a reason for apache shutdown.

The parent did get a SIGTERM, right here:

13:47:18 select(0, NULL, NULL, NULL, {1, 0}) = ? ERESTARTNOHAND (To be
restarted)
13:47:19 --- SIGTERM (Terminated) @ 0 (0) ---

is the parent running as root?  If so the child crashes are likely to be
unrelated to whatever happens to parent.  Debugging the child crashes would be a
good first step; can you obtain a backtrace and attach it to this report?

  http://httpd.apache.org/dev/debugging.html#crashes
